function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Antiviral drugs like Tamiflu and Relenza are stockpiled globally and deployed during pandemics, leading to high proportions of communities taking the drugs in a short time window, resulting in the drugs and their metabolites being present in wastewater.","Impact":"Presence of antiviral drugs and their metabolites in wastewater can lead to environmental contamination and potential irreversible effects on viral genomes, contributing to the development of drug resistance.","Mitigation":"Enhance monitoring and surveillance of antiviral drug presence and metabolites in wastewater, and develop advanced wastewater treatment technologies for removal.","Technologies":"Advanced chemical analysis and biological monitoring tools, as well as specialized wastewater treatment technologies for removing antiviral drugs and their metabolites.","People":"Communities exposed to contaminated wastewater, wildlife populations near contaminated water bodies.","Owner":"Health and environmental agencies, wastewater treatment facilities, research institutions."},{"Description":"Antiviral drugs, if present in low levels in the environment, could cause irreversible effects to viral genomes, leading to resistance.","Impact":"Development of antiviral drug resistance, especially in wildlife populations exposed to contaminated surface waters.","Mitigation":"Conduct comprehensive environmental impact studies on the presence of antiviral drugs and their metabolites in water bodies, develop strategies to minimize environmental exposure, and research alternative drug compounds with lower environmental impact.","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring tools, genetic analysis, and advanced drug compounds research.","People":"Wildlife populations, environmental regulatory agencies, research institutions.","Owner":"Environmental agencies, research institutions, pharmaceutical companies."},{"Description":"Presence of antiviral drugs and their metabolized forms in wastewater streams contribute to environmental contamination and potential long-term impacts on microbial resistance.","Impact":"Environmental contamination, potential development of microbial resistance in water bodies and wildlife populations.","Mitigation":"Develop advanced wastewater treatment processes specifically designed to remove antiviral drugs and their metabolites from wastewater, and increase monitoring and research on their environmental impact.","Technologies":"Specialized wastewater treatment technologies, environmental monitoring tools, and advanced microbial resistance research.","People":"Communities using water bodies for various purposes, wildlife populations, environmental regulatory agencies, wastewater treatment facilities.","Owner":"Environmental and health agencies, wastewater treatment facilities, research institutions."}]}
